meta.title: Bay Area Wedding Venues Guide
meta.description: Comprehensive list of wedding venues in North Bay, Peninsula, South Bay, Monterey, Santa Cruz, and Carmel areas

venues.name: Charles Krug Winery
venues.description: California's oldest winery (1861) offering historic charm with vineyard views. One of only five Napa wineries legally permitted to host weddings. Features the Carriage House with vaulted ceilings and reclaimed wine barrel wood.

reviews.summary: Staff praised as responsive and professional. Beautiful upstairs reception hall. Note: Beer/wine only, no liquor. Events must end at 10pm.

venues.name: V. Sattui Winery
venues.description: Award-winning Tuscan-style winery named among Top Five Winery Wedding Venues in The World. Features a stunning barrel room lit with candles and gorgeous florals throughout.

reviews.summary: Fairy-tale barrel room setting. Events allowed until 11pm. Mixed reviews on catering quality during peak season.

venues.name: Viansa Sonoma Winery
venues.description: Tuscan architecture with breathtaking Sonoma Valley views. Features romantic courtyard, Pavilion, and Barrel Room. Staff receives extremely high praise for attentiveness.

reviews.summary: Magical sunset views during cocktail hour. Requires full-service wedding planner. Can be windy in late summer.

venues.name: Beringer Vineyards
venues.description: Historic Victorian winery founded in 1876. Features the Rhine House mansion with 17th-century German-style architecture and stunning gardens.

reviews.summary: Historic Rhine House is architectural gem. Beautiful gardens and grounds.

venues.name: Carneros Resort and Spa
venues.description: Luxury resort with 28 acres of rolling vineyards and gardens. Features multiple indoor and outdoor venues with stunning wine country views.

reviews.summary: Luxury accommodations with wine country charm. Excellent spa services for wedding parties.

venues.name: Mountain House Estate
venues.description: 40 acres of rolling hills with Live Oak and Redwood trees. Exclusive use of entire venue, late hours until 2am. Owners praised for flexibility and personal touch.

reviews.summary: Venue so stunning minimal decor needed. Late hours (2am) are rare find. Flexible with vendors.

venues.name: Chateau St. Jean
venues.description: French Chateau-style winery with stunning gardens and Mediterranean architecture. Features elegant grounds perfect for outdoor ceremonies.

reviews.summary: Elegant French-inspired setting with beautiful formal gardens.

venues.name: Garden Valley Ranch
venues.description: Charming rose farm with 8 acres of gardens. Budget-friendly option with intimate setting among thousands of rose bushes.

reviews.summary: Romantic rose garden setting. Great value for intimate weddings.

venues.name: Marin Art & Garden Center
venues.address: 30 Sir Francis Drake Blvd, Ross, CA 94957
venues.description: Beautiful garden venue in Marin County with multiple outdoor spaces including a stunning amphitheater and historic buildings.

reviews.summary: Beautiful gardens in convenient Marin location. Variety of ceremony spaces.

venues.name: Deer Park Villa
venues.description: Stunning redwood grove setting in the heart of Marin. Features outdoor ceremony space surrounded by majestic redwood trees.

reviews.summary: Magical redwood grove ceremony space. Large capacity for outdoor events.

venues.name: Filoli Historic House & Garden
venues.description: National Historic Landmark featuring 16 acres of English Renaissance gardens and a 54,000 sq ft Georgian Revival mansion. Nine event spaces available.

reviews.summary: Stunning historic venue with meticulously curated gardens. Requires approved wedding planner. Premium pricing reflects exclusive experience.

venues.name: Kohl Mansion
venues.description: 1914 Tudor Revival mansion on the National Register of Historic Places. Features English rose garden, oak woodlands, and elegant Great Hall with grand staircase.

reviews.summary: Gorgeous historic mansion with exclusive use included. No corkage fees. Responsive professional staff.

venues.name: Thomas Fogarty Winery
venues.description: Perched 2,000 feet above Silicon Valley with panoramic bay views from San Francisco to San Jose. Floor-to-ceiling windows showcase stunning vineyard setting.

videos.title: Mountain Top Wedding at Thomas Fogarty

reviews.summary: Amazing panoramic views. 9-hour rental included. Can get chilly at night - recommend backup plan.

venues.name: The Mountain Terrace
venues.description: Redwood forest venue with large outdoor meadow, indoor bar and dance floor, terrace dining, and stunning bay views.

reviews.summary: Stunning redwood setting. Excellent coordinators. Delicious food and service.

venues.name: The Ritz-Carlton Half Moon Bay
venues.address: 1 Miramontes Point Road, Half Moon Bay, CA 94019
venues.description: Dramatic luxury resort on ocean bluffs with sweeping Pacific views. Features elegant ballrooms and oceanfront lawn for ceremonies.

videos.title: Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay Wedding

reviews.summary: Stunning oceanfront setting with top-notch Ritz-Carlton service. Very expensive. Some reports of inconsistent food quality.

venues.name: Rosewood Sand Hill
venues.address: 2825 Sand Hill Road, Menlo Park, CA 94025
venues.description: Forbes Five-Star luxury resort on 16 pristine acres with Santa Cruz Mountain views. Features glamorous ballroom and expansive outdoor lawns.

reviews.summary: Five-star luxury experience with stunning grounds. Premium pricing.

venues.name: Domenico Winery
venues.description: Boutique urban winery with industrial-chic ambiance. Features white-washed brick walls, wine barrels, 20-foot ceilings, and 30-foot bar.

reviews.summary: Winery experience without driving to Napa/Sonoma. Industrial-chic vibe.

venues.name: Sam's Chowder House
venues.address: 4210 Cabrillo Highway North, Half Moon Bay, CA 94019
venues.description: Award-winning oceanfront restaurant on a cliff overlooking Pillar Point Harbor. Beach ceremonies available with beachfront lawn.

reviews.summary: Best waterfront dining in Bay Area. Beach ceremony option available.

venues.name: Nestldown
venues.address: 22420 Old Santa Cruz Hwy, Los Gatos, CA 95033
venues.description: 180-acre private estate in Santa Cruz Mountains with 36 acres of gardens surrounded by redwoods. Features ponds, waterfalls, koi pond, topiary serpents, and fairy cottage.

reviews.summary: Magical gardens with whimsical touches like dragon sculpture and mini train. Exclusive use. Must use approved vendors.

venues.name: Villa Montalvo at Montalvo Arts Center
venues.description: 1912 Nationally Registered Historic Landmark featuring 150+ acres with Mediterranean-styled mansion and sweeping Santa Cruz Mountain views.

reviews.summary: Stunning historic mansion with Love Temple. Exclusive use. Premium pricing but worth it for the setting.

venues.name: Hakone Estate and Gardens
venues.description: The oldest and largest Japanese garden in the Western Hemisphere. Features 18 acres of tranquil gardens with koi pond, Moon Bridge, and bamboo garden.

reviews.summary: Unique Japanese garden setting. BYO alcohol permitted. Felt like destination wedding in Japan.

venues.name: The Mountain Winery
venues.description: Historic 600-acre Paul Masson property with 12 venue spaces offering breathtaking panoramic views of Silicon Valley from the Vista Deck.

reviews.summary: 12 venue spaces with stunning views. Responsive coordinator. No rain plan for Vista Deck.

venues.name: Saratoga Springs
venues.description: 5th-generation family venue in redwood forest featuring Cathedral Grove, Redwood Grove, Longbridge, and Creekside Room.

reviews.summary: Fairy-tale Long Bridge ceremony. Allows outside catering. Good value for redwood setting.

venues.name: Regale Winery and Vineyards
venues.description: Italian and French-inspired winery in Santa Cruz Mountains with Tuscan charm, vaulted ceilings, and lush gardens.

reviews.summary: Intimate Tuscan-style winery. Tables, chairs, DJ, and audio included.

venues.name: Cinnabar Hills Golf Club
venues.description: Award-winning golf club voted Best Wedding Venue in Silicon Valley. Features landscaped outdoor patio and indoor reception with towering skylights.

reviews.summary: Voted Best Wedding Venue in Silicon Valley. Rolling hills backdrop. In-house catering.

venues.name: Corinthian Grand Ballroom
venues.description: 1924 Scottish Rite Temple in Downtown San Jose with 50-foot ceilings, massive wooden beams, and blue glass panes with gold leaf grillwork.

reviews.summary: Stunning historic architecture with dramatic 50-foot ceilings. Downtown San Jose location.

venues.name: Willow Heights Mansion
venues.address: 1978 Willow Springs Rd, Morgan Hill, CA 95037
venues.description: 16,000 sq ft private estate on 26 acres of rolling hills and vineyards. Features marble fireplaces, crystal chandeliers, and 360-degree terrace views.

reviews.summary: Stunning private estate with overnight accommodations. 360-degree views.

venues.name: Guglielmo Winery - Villa Emile
venues.address: 1480 E Main Ave, Morgan Hill, CA 95037
venues.description: Family-owned Italian winery since 1925 with 85 acres of vineyards. Features Villa Emile Event Center with green lawn, covered stage, and Heritage Room.

reviews.summary: Old-world Italian charm. All-inclusive packages available.

venues.name: The Barns at Cooper Molera
venues.description: Historic venue from the 1860s in downtown Monterey with lush gardens of wildflowers, fruit trees, and roses. Combines rustic barn charm with garden settings.

reviews.summary: Walking distance to downtown Monterey. Beautiful gardens with abundant photo ops.

venues.name: Monterey Plaza Hotel & Spa
venues.description: Luxury waterfront hotel on Cannery Row near Monterey Bay Aquarium. Features dramatic oceanfront ceremony spaces and elegant ballrooms.

reviews.summary: Stunning oceanfront location on Cannery Row. Award-winning California coastal cuisine.

venues.name: Monterey Bay Aquarium
venues.description: Unique venue allowing weddings among world-class marine exhibits including Open Sea Gallery, Kelp Forest, and Great Tide Pool.

reviews.summary: Exchange vows in front of jellyfish, sharks, and sea turtles. Most spectacular venue imaginable.

venues.name: The Lodge at Pebble Beach
venues.description: Legendary resort on the famous 18th fairway overlooking Stillwater Cove. World-class accommodations with unmatched coastal golf course views.

reviews.summary: Iconic 18th hole backdrop. World-famous setting with luxury accommodations.

venues.name: The Inn at Spanish Bay
venues.description: Contemporary luxury resort among majestic pines with over 14,000 sq ft of event space. Features bagpiper at sunset tradition.

reviews.summary: Grand Ballroom with vaulted ceilings. Bagpiper at sunset tradition.

venues.name: Post Ranch Inn
venues.description: Ultra-luxury resort built into Big Sur cliffs overlooking Pacific. Ideal for microweddings and elopements.

reviews.summary: Five-star service with breathtaking cliff views. Best for intimate weddings under 40 guests.

venues.name: Ventana Big Sur
venues.description: 160-acre rustic resort with Sur Vista terrace offering sweeping Pacific views. Features redwood forests, meadows, and multiple pools.

reviews.summary: 5 ceremony sites including Redwood Cathedral and Ocean Meadow. Warmer than coastal areas.

venues.name: Dream Inn Santa Cruz
venues.address: 175 W Cliff Dr, Santa Cruz, CA 95060
venues.description: Iconic beachfront hotel with panoramic views of the Boardwalk, Wharf, and Monterey Bay. Features 3,500 sq ft Dream Ballroom with floor-to-ceiling windows.

reviews.summary: Beachfront location with stunning bay views. Coordinator Katie praised as rockstar.

venues.name: Seascape Beach Resort
venues.description: Oceanfront resort with three distinct venues: The Bluff overlooking Monterey Bay, The Island with fountains and palm trees, and 17-mile private beach.

reviews.summary: Three venue options with private beach access. On-site accommodations.

venues.name: Roaring Camp Railroads
venues.description: Historic railroad and logging camp in old-growth redwood forest. Unique steam train transports guests to Cathedral Grove ceremony site.

reviews.summary: Unique steam train experience through redwoods. Old-growth forest setting. Free rehearsal day.

venues.name: Kennolyn Hilltop Hacienda
venues.description: Picturesque hilltop hideaway on 240 acres overlooking Monterey Bay. Spanish-style architecture with fountains, courtyards, and terraces.

reviews.summary: All-inclusive packages reduce planning stress. Monterey Bay views from hilltop. No corkage fees.

venues.name: Chaminade Resort & Spa
venues.description: 300-acre woodland resort with Spanish heritage and Monterey Bay views. Features 156 guest rooms and Spanish-inspired courtyard with fountain.

reviews.summary: All-inclusive packages with complimentary wedding night stay. Spanish-inspired courtyard.

venues.name: Fern River Resort
venues.description: Family resort in redwoods along flowing river. Features custom redwood gazebo, manicured meadow, and 15 cabins for guest accommodations.

reviews.summary: Budget-friendly redwood setting. 15 cabins for guest lodging. Four ceremony locations.

venues.name: Felton Guild
venues.description: Magical redwood grove with towering ancient trees creating natural cathedral. Outdoor venue with on-site Cowboy Bar & Grill catering.

reviews.summary: Affordable redwood cathedral setting. In business since 1994. On-site catering available.

venues.name: Holman Ranch
venues.description: 750-acre nationally recognized estate that hosted Charlie Chaplin gatherings since 1928. Features historic hacienda, award-winning wines, and exclusive property access.

reviews.summary: Only one event at a time for exclusivity. Almost everything included. Staff makes couples feel like family.

venues.name: Folktale Winery & Vineyards
venues.description: French-style chateau with 15 acres of sustainably farmed vineyards. Features stunning Barrel Room with 500+ wine barrels and chandeliers.

reviews.summary: Venue naturally decorates itself. Multiple indoor/outdoor spaces. 2026 discounts available.

venues.name: Mission Ranch
venues.description: Historic 22-acre ranch restored by Clint Eastwood. Spectacular views of Point Lobos, Carmel River Beach, and Pacific Ocean. Features resident sheep.

reviews.summary: Best wedding food guests ever had. Dramatic bridge entrance for bride. Like traveling to Ireland.

venues.name: Carmel Valley Ranch
venues.description: 500+ acre luxury resort with vineyard, organic garden, 18-hole golf course, and Santa Lucia Mountain views. Vineyard Lawn nestled among Pinot Noir grapevines.

reviews.summary: 5-star treatment throughout. Farm-to-table ingredients grown on property.

venues.name: Bernardus Lodge & Spa
venues.address: 415 West Carmel Valley Road, Carmel Valley, CA 93924
venues.description: 73-room boutique resort on 28 acres with 100+ rose varieties, 5 acres of lavender, and 8 acres of vineyards. Wedding garden with oak backdrop.

reviews.summary: Award-winning spa and restaurant. Beautiful rose gardens and lavender fields.

venues.name: Hyatt Carmel Highlands
venues.description: Historic 100-year-old resort perched on cliff overlooking Pacific and Big Sur coastline. Features open-air redwood deck ceremony space.

reviews.summary: Dramatic Pacific Ocean ceremony backdrop. 100+ years of wedding history.

venues.name: Stonepine Estate
venues.address: 150 East Carmel Valley Road, Carmel Valley, CA 93924
venues.description: 400+ acre Tuscan-style estate featuring 1929 Chateau Noel villa with ivy-covered walls. Includes private chapel, equestrian center, and formal gardens.

reviews.summary: Private chapel on property. Equestrian center with 5 miles of trails. Formal Tuscan gardens.

venues.name: La Playa Hotel
venues.address: Camino Real at 8th Avenue, Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA 93921
venues.description: Historic 1905 Spanish-style mansion two blocks from beach. Following $20 million renovation in 2023, features lush English gardens with 600+ flower varieties.

reviews.summary: Award-winning gardens after $20M renovation. Two blocks from Carmel beach.

venues.name: Quail Lodge & Golf Club
venues.description: Resort and golf club 10 minutes from downtown Carmel. Features Quail Meadows outdoor venue with rustic barn, lake, and 8,500+ sq ft of event space.

reviews.summary: Multiple venue options including Glass House for intimate events. 18-hole championship golf.

venues.name: Carmel Fields by Wedgewood
venues.description: Spanish Colonial-style venue with coastal access. Offers garden ceremony or beach ceremonies at Monastery Beach. Most affordable option in Carmel area.

reviews.summary: Most affordable Carmel option. All-inclusive packages with beach ceremony option.

venues.name: Four Seasons Resort Napa Valley
venues.description: Ultra-luxury resort with vineyard views, multiple event spaces, and world-class accommodations.

venues.name: Solage, Auberge Resorts Collection
venues.description: Luxury spa resort with contemporary design, multiple indoor/outdoor venues, and award-winning dining.

venues.name: Auberge du Soleil
venues.description: Ultra-luxury hillside resort with Michelin-starred restaurant, olive groves, and panoramic valley views.

venues.name: Churchill Manor
venues.description: Historic Victorian B&B with beautiful gardens, wrap-around veranda, and romantic charm.

venues.name: CIA at Greystone
venues.description: Culinary Institute of America's historic stone building with stunning architecture and exceptional catering.

venues.name: Gundlach Bundschu Winery
venues.description: California's oldest family-owned winery (since 1858) with stunning vineyard views and historic charm.

venues.name: Kunde Family Winery
venues.description: Estate winery with spectacular views, wine caves, and multiple event spaces.

venues.name: Jacuzzi Family Vineyards
venues.description: Italian-style estate with olive groves, bocce courts, and Tuscan architecture.

venues.name: Vintners Resort
venues.description: Award-winning resort surrounded by 92 acres of vineyards with multiple event venues.

venues.name: Cavallo Point Lodge
venues.description: Historic lodge at the base of Golden Gate Bridge with stunning bay views and luxury accommodations.

venues.name: Nick's Cove
venues.description: Waterfront restaurant and cottages on Tomales Bay with oyster bar and rustic charm.

venues.name: Old St. Hillary's
venues.description: Historic 1888 Gothic Revival chapel with panoramic Bay and Angel Island views.

venues.name: Peninsula Golf & Country Club
venues.description: Private country club with sweeping golf course views and elegant clubhouse.

venues.name: Half Moon Bay Golf Links
venues.address: 2 Miramontes Point Rd, Half Moon Bay, CA 94019
venues.description: Oceanfront golf venue with breathtaking coastal views and Grand Event Marquee.

venues.name: Hotel Nia
venues.description: Luxury Silicon Valley hotel with 15,000+ sq ft of event space and modern elegance.

venues.name: El Prado Hotel
venues.description: Forbes-rated boutique hotel with Spanish Revival charm and enchanting courtyard.

venues.name: Crowne Plaza Foster City
venues.description: Stylish Peninsula hotel with 23,000 sq ft of event space including grand Magellan Ballroom.

venues.name: Oceano Hotel & Spa
venues.address: 280 Capistrano Rd, Half Moon Bay, CA 94019
venues.description: Waterfront hotel with 12,000+ sq ft of event space overlooking Pillar Point Harbor.

venues.name: Mavericks House
venues.description: Stunning waterfront venue with 180-degree ocean views and in-house catering.

venues.name: Mill Rose Inn
venues.address: 615 Mill St, Half Moon Bay, CA 94019
venues.description: Charming B&B with gorgeous rose gardens and romantic outdoor setting.

venues.name: Allied Arts Guild
venues.description: Spanish Colonial architecture with lush gardens, beautiful tile work, and historic charm.

venues.name: San Mateo County History Museum
venues.description: 1910 Old County Courthouse with stunning stained-glass dome and marble columns.

venues.name: Hiller Aviation Museum
venues.description: Largest indoor aviation museum in California with unique aircraft displays.

venues.name: CuriOdyssey
venues.address: 1651 Coyote Point Dr, San Mateo, CA 94401
venues.description: Science museum and wildlife center with Redwood Hall and optional animal encounters.

venues.name: Pearson Ranch
venues.description: 150-acre historic ranch with renovated 100-year-old barn and rustic charm.

venues.name: Fairmont San Jose
venues.address: 170 S Market St, San Jose, CA 95113
venues.description: Luxury hotel with 65,000 sq ft of event space including Imperial and Regency Ballrooms.

venues.name: Hayes Mansion
venues.description: Historic mansion estate with 33,000 sq ft of function space and lush gardens.

venues.name: San Jose Marriott
venues.address: 211 S First St, San Jose, CA 95113
venues.description: Downtown hotel with 23,000 sq ft of event space and rooftop observation deck.

venues.name: Testarossa Winery
venues.description: Historic 1888 winery with redwood garden patio and enchanting wine caves.

venues.name: Clos LaChance Winery
venues.description: Certified sustainable winery with 100 acres of vineyards and multiple event spaces.

venues.name: Kirigin Cellars
venues.description: Historic 1916 winery with 33 acres of vineyards, 1,000 rose bushes, and Tuscan-style clubhouse.

venues.name: Boulder Ridge by Wedgewood
venues.address: 1000 Old Quarry Rd, San Jose, CA 95123
venues.description: Hilltop venue with panoramic Almaden Valley views and all-inclusive packages.

venues.name: Silver Creek Valley Country Club
venues.address: 5460 Country Club Pkwy, San Jose, CA 95138
venues.description: Italian villa-inspired clubhouse with lakeside ceremony site and cascading waterfall.

venues.name: Villa Ragusa
venues.description: European-style banquet hall with 12,000 sq ft, marble staircase, and 14-foot ceilings.

venues.name: Club Auto Sport
venues.description: Unique venue featuring exotic car collection, tropical oasis, and 42-ft granite bar.

venues.name: Computer History Museum
venues.address: 1401 N Shoreline Blvd, Mountain View, CA 94043
venues.description: Award-winning museum with 12,000 sq ft Grand Hall in the heart of Silicon Valley.

venues.name: The Ameswell Hotel
venues.description: Bay Area's first carbon neutral hotel with 15,000+ sq ft of event space.

venues.name: La Foret Restaurant
venues.description: Award-winning French restaurant in historic New Almaden foothills mansion.

venues.name: The Sanctuary Beach Resort
venues.description: Only resort in the area offering beach ceremonies on 19 acres of beachfront property.

venues.name: Portola Hotel & Spa
venues.description: Downtown Monterey hotel with 60,000 sq ft of indoor and outdoor event space.

venues.name: Asilomar Conference Grounds
venues.description: 107-acre beachfront venue with Julia Morgan-designed buildings and 313 guest rooms.

venues.name: TPC Monterey at Pasadera
venues.description: Hacienda-style venue with Spanish Rose Courtyard and Ancient Oak Event Lawn.

venues.name: Carmel Mission Basilica
venues.description: Historic Spanish Colonial mission and iconic California landmark for Catholic ceremonies.

venues.name: Memory Garden at Monterey State Historic Park
venues.description: Historic garden enclosed by adobe wall with 15-foot fountain centerpiece.

venues.name: Pacific Grove Museum of Natural History
venues.description: Non-traditional venue with galleries and native plant garden near Lover's Point.

venues.name: Carmel Fields by Wedgewood
venues.description: All-inclusive venue with garden and beach ceremony options at Monastery Beach.

venues.name: The Holly Farm
venues.description: 7-acre jungle hideaway designed for 2-5 night destination weddings.

venues.name: Joullian Vineyards
venues.description: Mountain vineyard with Venue in the Vines and intimate Barrel Room.

venues.name: Waterfall Lodge & Retreat
venues.address: 325 Hidden Falls Trail, Ben Lomond, CA 95005
venues.description: 80-acre retreat with ancient redwoods, reclaimed 19th-century barn, and 33 cabins.

venues.name: The Sequoia Retreat Center
venues.description: Award-winning venue in old-growth redwoods with Peace Park and Las Alas Lodge.

venues.name: Amphitheater of the Redwoods at Pema Osel Ling
venues.description: Buddhist retreat center with fairy ring of ancient redwoods for ceremonies.

venues.name: The Grove (Cocoanut Grove)
venues.description: Historic 1907 venue - Bay Area's largest oceanfront event space at the Beach Boardwalk.

venues.name: Seymour Marine Discovery Center
venues.description: Oceanfront aquarium and science center on a secluded bluff above Monterey Bay.

venues.name: UCSC Cowell Ranch Hay Barn
venues.description: Historic 1860 barn on National Register with 30 acres of farmland and bay views.

venues.name: The Hollins House
venues.description: Historic 1931 mansion overlooking Pasatiempo Golf Club with Monterey Bay views.

venues.name: Highlands House & Park
venues.description: Elegant 1940s mansion in enchanted Santa Cruz Mountain forests.

venues.name: Quail Hollow Ranch County Park
venues.description: Former Sunset Magazine publisher's home with ranch house, lawn, and orchard views.

venues.name: Shadowbrook Restaurant
venues.description: Iconic 1947 restaurant reached by cable car, named Most Romantic in Northern California.

venues.name: Aveline
venues.address: 1700 Granite Creek Rd, Santa Cruz, CA 95065
venues.description: 88-acre mountaintop estate with panoramic Monterey Bay views and old-world villa charm.

venues.name: Albatross Ridge
venues.description: 236-acre elevated vineyard with 360-degree views of Carmel Coast and Valley.

venues.name: L'Auberge Carmel
venues.address: Monte Verde at Seventh, Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA 93921
venues.description: Relais & Chateaux property with Forbes Five Star restaurant and 4,500-bottle wine cellar.

venues.name: Carmel Mission Inn
venues.description: Hotel at gateway to Big Sur with 4,500+ sq ft of event space and Central Coast views.

venues.name: Tickle Pink Inn
venues.description: Luxury boutique inn on cliffs overlooking Pacific Ocean and Big Sur coastline.

venues.name: Cypress Inn
venues.description: Beloved 1929 boutique hotel co-owned by Doris Day with Terry's Restaurant & Lounge.

venues.name: Villa Sopra Vista
venues.description: Ultra-luxury 15-acre private estate with panoramic Pacific coast views.

venues.name: Santa Lucia Preserve
venues.address: 1 Rancho San Carlos Rd, Carmel, CA 93923
venues.description: 20,000-acre private preserve with historic Hacienda and iconic Redwood Grove ceremony site.

venues.name: Gardener Ranch
venues.address: 114 W Carmel Valley Rd, Carmel Valley, CA 93924
venues.description: 24-acre property alongside Carmel River with five ceremony sites and overnight lodging.

venues.name: Tehama Golf Club
venues.description: Clint Eastwood's private community with 18,000 sq ft Spanish-style clubhouse.

venues.name: Galante Vineyards
venues.description: 700-acre historic cattle ranch and premium Cabernet Sauvignon vineyard.
